title: Twitter Blue subscribers can now use custom app icons on Android
content:
In our modern age and time, services are slowly adopting the subscription model. And that’s completely understandable, as the continuous development and maintenance of the platforms we use come at a cost. When a company offers both free and premium tiers of its service, paid subscribers usually unlock extra features and capabilities as an incentive

The post Twitter Blue subscribers can now use custom app icons on Android appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Twitter Blue subscribers can now use a variety of custom app icons on Android. The feature had been exclusive to iOS users since its launch.
